page.title: 05BRAYFORD POOL, LINCOLN.
page.content: The {Brayford }was originally a{Roman {inland port}which became an important commercial centre throughout Lincoln's history. The{Fossdyke Canal }links it with the {River Trent}and boats can reach the{Wash}along the{River Witham. Warehouses once stored grain,cloth and many other goods. Railways and silting of the rivers have ruined the trade. Now the Brayford is used for pleasure boating and sports. Every year in June the{Lincoln Water Festival}takes place here,featuring water ballet,fireworks, raft races, quayside events and lots more. There are times for fishing, boating or just plain lazing about.The area is always {busy}because of the waterside pubs and supermarkets. Thousands of boats pass through the pool each year and it has now become the{inland waterway centre}of the East Midlands.
